<p>The <a href="/wiki/Equestrianism" title="Equestrianism">equestrian</a> events at the <a href="/wiki/2012_Summer_Olympics" title="2012 Summer Olympics">2012 Olympic Games</a> in <a href="/wiki/London" title="London">London</a> were held between 28 July and 9 August at <a href="/wiki/Greenwich_Park" title="Greenwich Park">Greenwich Park</a>. Medals were awarded in three disciplines for both individual and team competitions.</p>
<p><a href="/wiki/Great_Britain_at_the_2012_Summer_Olympics" title="Great Britain at the 2012 Summer Olympics">Great Britain</a> was the most successful nation, topping the medal table with three golds and five medals in total. They were particularly dominant in team events, taking two gold medals and a silver medal from three team events.</p>

<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Events">Events</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=Equestrian_at_the_2012_Summer_Olympics&amp;action=edit&amp;section=1" title="Edit section: Events">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h2>
<div class="thumb tright">
<div class="thumbinner" style="width:222px;"><a href="/wiki/File:Greenwich_Park_001.JPG" class="image"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/0/06/Greenwich_Park_001.JPG/220px-Greenwich_Park_001.JPG" width="220" height="165" class="thumbimage" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/0/06/Greenwich_Park_001.JPG/330px-Greenwich_Park_001.JPG 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/0/06/Greenwich_Park_001.JPG/440px-Greenwich_Park_001.JPG 2x" /></a>
<div class="thumbcaption">
<div class="magnify"><a href="/wiki/File:Greenwich_Park_001.JPG" class="internal" title="Enlarge"><img src="//bits.wikimedia.org/static-1.22wmf21/skins/common/images/magnify-clip.png" width="15" height="11" alt="" /></a></div>
<a href="/wiki/Greenwich_Park" title="Greenwich Park">Greenwich Park</a> hosted the equestrian events.</div>
</div>
</div>
<p>Medals were awarded in the following competitions:</p>
<ul>
<li><a href="/wiki/Equestrian_at_the_2012_Summer_Olympics_%E2%80%93_Individual_dressage" title="Equestrian at the 2012 Summer Olympics 每 Individual dressage">Individual dressage</a></li>
<li><a href="/wiki/Equestrian_at_the_2012_Summer_Olympics_%E2%80%93_Team_dressage" title="Equestrian at the 2012 Summer Olympics 每 Team dressage">Team dressage</a></li>
<li><a href="/wiki/Equestrian_at_the_2012_Summer_Olympics_%E2%80%93_Individual_jumping" title="Equestrian at the 2012 Summer Olympics 每 Individual jumping">Individual jumping</a></li>
<li><a href="/wiki/Equestrian_at_the_2012_Summer_Olympics_%E2%80%93_Team_jumping" title="Equestrian at the 2012 Summer Olympics 每 Team jumping">Team jumping</a></li>
<li><a href="/wiki/Equestrian_at_the_2012_Summer_Olympics_%E2%80%93_Individual_eventing" title="Equestrian at the 2012 Summer Olympics 每 Individual eventing">Individual eventing</a></li>
<li><a href="/wiki/Equestrian_at_the_2012_Summer_Olympics_%E2%80%93_Team_eventing" title="Equestrian at the 2012 Summer Olympics 每 Team eventing">Team eventing</a></li>
</ul>
<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Qualification">Qualification</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=Equestrian_at_the_2012_Summer_Olympics&amp;action=edit&amp;section=2" title="Edit section: Qualification">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h2>
<div class="rellink boilerplate seealso">For more details on this topic, see <a href="/wiki/Equestrian_at_the_2012_Summer_Olympics_-_Qualification" title="Equestrian at the 2012 Summer Olympics - Qualification" class="mw-redirect">Equestrian at the 2012 Summer Olympics - Qualification</a>.</div>
<p>Each event has its own qualification rules, but generally rely on FEI rankings.</p>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Dressage_qualification">Dressage qualification</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=Equestrian_at_the_2012_Summer_Olympics&amp;action=edit&amp;section=3" title="Edit section: Dressage qualification">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h3>
<p>For the team competition there was a total of 11 quota spots available. Three team spots were awarded at the <a href="/wiki/2010_FEI_World_Equestrian_Games" title="2010 FEI World Equestrian Games">2010 FEI World Equestrian Games</a>. In addition 7 team spots were awarded at regional competitions (Europe: 3, America: 2, Asia: 2). In addition, should a country have qualified 3 athletes in the individual competition, they also qualify as a team and were allowed to compete in the team competition.<sup id="cite_ref-bbc_1-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-bbc-1"><span>[</span>1<span>]</span></a></sup></p>
<p>For the individual competition, 50 spots were allocated as follows: 33 to the athletes who qualified from the teams above. In addition, the highest ranked rider from each of seven geographic regions qualified. The top ten riders based on FEI ranking who did not qualify otherwise were given spots as well.<sup id="cite_ref-bbc_1-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-bbc-1"><span>[</span>1<span>]</span></a></sup></p>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Jumping_qualification">Jumping qualification</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=Equestrian_at_the_2012_Summer_Olympics&amp;action=edit&amp;section=4" title="Edit section: Jumping qualification">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h3>
<p>A country may send up to four riders if it qualified for the team competition. Similar to dressage, teams of four riders were qualified at either the World Equestrian Games (WEG) or through a regional competition. The WEG awarded five spots, the regions six (America: two, Europe: two, Asia: two), and the hosts (Great Britain). For the individual competition there was a total of 75 spots allocated as follows: 45 from the above teams the rest regional or through rankings.<sup id="cite_ref-bbc_1-2" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-bbc-1"><span>[</span>1<span>]</span></a></sup></p>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Eventing_qualification">Eventing qualification</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=Equestrian_at_the_2012_Summer_Olympics&amp;action=edit&amp;section=5" title="Edit section: Eventing qualification">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h3>
<p>A country may send up to five riders if it qualified for the team competition. Similar to dressage, teams of five riders were qualified at either the WEG, a regional competition, or through a composite spot. The WEG awarded five spots, the regions seven (America: three, Europe: three, Middle East &amp; Africa: one), the hosts (Great Britain). For the individual competition there was a total of 75 spots allocated as follows: 55 from the above teams, 7 through regional competitions and 13 through the world rankings.<sup id="cite_ref-bbc_1-3" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-bbc-1"><span>[</span>1<span>]</span></a></sup></p>
<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Competition_format">Competition format</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=Equestrian_at_the_2012_Summer_Olympics&amp;action=edit&amp;section=6" title="Edit section: Competition format">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h2>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Show_jumping">Show jumping</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=Equestrian_at_the_2012_Summer_Olympics&amp;action=edit&amp;section=7" title="Edit section: Show jumping">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h3>
<p>Five rounds are ridden to determine individual medals. Riders placing first through 60th (including ties for 60th place) advance to the second round. The top 45 riders of round 2, including ties for 45th, advance to the third round. The top 35 riders of the third round progress to the 4th round, but only up to three riders per team (so if a country has four riders in the top 35, one of those is not allowed to compete for individual medals).</p>
<p>In the fourth round (individual final round A), the slate is wiped clean and all riders begin with zero faults. The top 20 riders in round 4 advance to round 5 (individual final round B), and ride another course. The faults for individual final round A and B and added together to determine individual medals.</p>
<p>The team competition completes three rounds to determine medals. It runs concurrently with the individual competition (riders running over the same course) so team riders are also competing for individual medals. The first round for team competition is the round 2 course for individual medals. The top eight teams from the first team round advance to the second team round (which is the same course as the individual round 3). The scores for these eight countries over team rounds 1 and 2 are combined, and medals are awarded based on those scores.</p>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Dressage">Dressage</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=Equestrian_at_the_2012_Summer_Olympics&amp;action=edit&amp;section=8" title="Edit section: Dressage">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h3>
<div class="thumb tright">
<div class="thumbinner" style="width:152px;"><a href="/wiki/File:Nicola_Wilson_and_Opposition_Buzz_during_cross-country_at_2012_London_Olympics.jpg" class="image"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/1/1c/Nicola_Wilson_and_Opposition_Buzz_during_cross-country_at_2012_London_Olympics.jpg/150px-Nicola_Wilson_and_Opposition_Buzz_during_cross-country_at_2012_London_Olympics.jpg" width="150" height="225" class="thumbimage" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/1/1c/Nicola_Wilson_and_Opposition_Buzz_during_cross-country_at_2012_London_Olympics.jpg/225px-Nicola_Wilson_and_Opposition_Buzz_during_cross-country_at_2012_London_Olympics.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/1/1c/Nicola_Wilson_and_Opposition_Buzz_during_cross-country_at_2012_London_Olympics.jpg/300px-Nicola_Wilson_and_Opposition_Buzz_during_cross-country_at_2012_London_Olympics.jpg 2x" /></a>
<div class="thumbcaption">
<div class="magnify"><a href="/wiki/File:Nicola_Wilson_and_Opposition_Buzz_during_cross-country_at_2012_London_Olympics.jpg" class="internal" title="Enlarge"><img src="//bits.wikimedia.org/static-1.22wmf21/skins/common/images/magnify-clip.png" width="15" height="11" alt="" /></a></div>
Nicola Wilson and Opposition Buzz competing in the cross-country discipline of the eventing</div>
</div>
</div>
<p>Teams are made up of three riders, all of whom are also competing concurrently for individual medals. Additionally, countries who can not make a full team may send riders to compete for individual medals.</p>
<p>All riders compete in the Grand Prix, which serves as the first round of both the individual and team medals. The top seven teams (included those tied for 7th) advance to the Grand Prix Special, which is a slightly more rigorous test. The combined scores for those teams in both the Grand Prix and the Special determine the team medals, with the team with the highest score winning gold.</p>
<p>Riders completing the Grand Prix test (first qualifying round of the individual competition) may move on to the Grand Prix Special (second qualifying round for the individual competition) if their team is in the top seven (21 riders total). Additionally, the top 11 riders who do not qualify with a team may also advance to the Special to ride for individual medals. The top 18 riders from the Special move on to the third individual round, the freestyle. Each rider designs their own test for the freestyle, which must be set to music and has several compulsory movements. Riders can tailor a test to their horses' strengths, as well as incorporate movements that are more difficult than those required in the Grand Prix or the Special (such as a pirouette in <a href="/wiki/Piaffe" title="Piaffe">piaffe</a>) in order to increase their scores. Individual medals are assigned based on scores in the freestyle.</p>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Eventing">Eventing</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=Equestrian_at_the_2012_Summer_Olympics&amp;action=edit&amp;section=9" title="Edit section: Eventing">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h3>
<p>Competitions for team and individual medals ran concurrently. Riders performed a dressage test, a cross-country round, and a jumping round. Team medals were then awarded by adding together the best three scores from a country's team, out of a maximum of five team members, from all three phases, the team with the lowest number of penalty points winning the gold. The top 25 individual scores after the first show jumping round performed a second, final, show jumping round to determine individual medals, with up to 3 riders in the individual running per team. Therefore, those competing for individual spots completed one dressage test and cross-country round, and two jumping rounds.</p>
